title: Honestly disappointed in riots ban system

replies.body:
> For starters i will say about 2-3 months ago i raged and ran it down mid lane. 

Whatever disappointments you have in the ban system are completely, utterly, 100% irrelevant. Everyone, and I mean **everyone**, has zero tolerance or patience for intentional feeders.

> Lets say i have another bad day

Your problems are not anyone else's problems. Nobody is required to have your shit inflicted on them because you're having a bad day.

> in our society no matter the sin we are taught that it can be forgiven and we can grow

We are? Because in the society I live in, nobody is **entitled** to forgiveness or absolution (which are different things, and you're expecting the latter). I sure as hell don't forgive or absolve rapists and murderers for their crimes. Riot has rules. You broke the rules. There are no feelings involved here.

> I have spent over $9000 on league

This entitles you to **nothing**.

> Tyler1

Tyler1 never got a single account back. Not a single one.
If you do any research into tyler1 you can see that league hunted him basically to get him away from league, eventually they gave in and reformed him.

If your "bad day" results in you intentionally feeding games, then yes, you deserve punishment. It's absolutely absurd that you think it's ever acceptable for you to take your frustration/bad day out on other people. That is selfish and horribly rude.

The rules have never changed. Intentionally feeding has **ALWAYS** resulted in a 14 day ban on first offense and a permanent ban on second offense. The reasoning is you shouldn't *need* a warning that it's unacceptable. If your response to frustration is to ruin other people's day, **then Riot does not want you to play League**. Riot is not going to give more chances, because **you don't need a warning**. It's absolutely unacceptable.
I think your misunderstanding by what a "bad day" is misconstrued  again were all human. If you disagree i wont argue id rather leave the comment section open for another argument and/or agreement.

I didn’t misunderstand anything. A normal human doesn’t go and commit mass murder just because of a “bad day”. You do not get to use “bad day” to justify something so outrageous and obviously bad that you never should’ve considered doing it.

Clearly you haven't seen society lately, even with the movies recently, the joker specifically. mental illness is a growing concern, and one day can push anyone over the line. Id rather someone take that out in a video game then in real life.

1.) That's a fictional movie. Mental illness is NOT a growing problem. It's becoming more UNDERSTOOD. Many people have mental illness and are not violent. That's actually offensive to think anyone with a mental illness = violent serial killer. I think you're the one that needs to wake up and see how society really is.

2.) If you're having such a bad day that you think of harming someone irl then you should seek professional help and I mean this in a non-insulting manner. That is not normal.

3.) Just because you're having a bad day doesn't mean you should take it out in other peoples' games in League of Legends. Why ruin other peoples' days because your's is bad? Why not make it better for them and actually be a good player? 
Your punishment is justified, don't whine because you didn't follow the rules.

again not reading my post im not saying my punishment isnt justified by any means i think you should be punished for any wrong doing. But their shouldnt be a lifetime of 1 chance. Look around the execution law doesnt exist anymore for a reasoon. So why should perma ban exist. Again im personally not banned from league i havent been in months. i just want to share my opinion on this subject. Giving 1 lifetime chance to any player then banning them seems unfair.

Also let me clarify im using the bad day as an example. When i ran it down those few months ago i was just having my own fun with those friends i was playing with. The only bad part of that day was me being banned.

Edit: also its my bad for how i worded that, i just meant the joker as an example and the moves growing concern as an example. Its not mental illness that people already have thats a concern. Ive survived a life of bullying and i have protected people from it. I do not get online and do such things ethier. But bullying can lead to a form of mental illness and thats what league is turning into. If you bully someone over that edge even to a point where they defend themselves in said game,  Riot has the right to ban you permanently for defending yourself against toxic players, because defending yourself is more toxic.
That's not an excuse. Period. "I didn't do something *worse*" isn't an excuse for doing something bad.

Your standing with the system does improve over time. But it takes a while, is dependent on your behavior (minor poor behavior will slow/halt this improvement), requires you to actually play games, and you have no indicator if you've moved back down the punishment ladder.

Having a bad day doesn't absolve you of the responsibility over your behavior. If you're having a bad day and don't think you can control yourself then it might be best that you don't hop into such a tense game.
Again according to riots rules they do not improve. Once youve made a mistake your next one is execution.

> [{quoted}](name=DecayedPenguini,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=kG7kqOMn,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2020-01-30T20:18:03.598+0000)
>
> Again according to riots rules they do not improve. Once youve made a mistake your next one is execution.

There have been people that admit that they've had far more chat restrictions than the two steps prior to a 14-day ban. There is also this;

https://support-leagueoflegends.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/207489286-Instant-Feedback-System-FAQ-

*"BUT WHAT IF I REFORM? IS IT POSSIBLE TO GO DOWN THE ESCALATION PATH?
Yes! Players who show consistent reform or show positive behavior in their games will help heal their accounts reputation."*

So where are you getting your information from to claim that there is no improvement process?

The reform doesnt exist anymore, the information im getting is from the report tht banned me. I talked to the moderator that reviewed my ban and he said if i ever get reported again, im banned forever which shows there is no reform like when chat bans existed. Cause again Chat restrictions are no longer a part of league because "they are ineffective" this is more recent of course like in the most recent eula. Which for once i decided to take my time to read and every word hurt.

> [{quoted}](name=DecayedPenguini,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=kG7kqOMn,comment-id=0001000100000000,timestamp=2020-01-31T23:40:15.233+0000)

Cause again Chat restrictions are no longer a part of league because "they are ineffective" this is more recent of course like in the most recent eula. Which for once i decided to take my time to read and every word hurt.

Where in the EULA does it say that the reform process doesn't happen? I gave direct links along with a quote, the least you can do is the same.

I also find it extremely likely that you're misrepresenting what support told you.

If you get perma-banned, then yeah, of course there is no reform. The perma-ban is Riot trying to get you to leave. But everything prior to a perma-ban allows you to improve your standing with the system.

The information about the non-reform part of what i said is from the 14-ban i got, and the eula statement has nothing to do with that, also i am typing quick messages if you want to look at the eula please do. its just what i got from reading it fully through, many pieces brought to one whole, not taking anything out of context like everyone else on this forum does, its like talking to the press.

as im trying to explain, video games for me and im sure for at least some others is used as an outlet of anger. So yea i do believe im responsible for what i did. I just think years of honor should count for something. 

like lets say you get banned then you get to honor 5 and stay there for say a year or 2 then you basically get your "chance" back.

> [{quoted}](name=DecayedPenguini,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=kG7kqOMn,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2020-01-30T03:47:58.528+0000)
>
> as im trying to explain, video games for me and im sure for at least some others is used as an outlet of anger. 

Videogames may be, but not your teammates. If you want a game where you can actively yell at someone play Rust. Being aggressive is part of that game.

Or simply play a single-player game and take your anger out on some NPCs.

>So yea i do believe im responsible for what i did. I just think years of honor should count for something.
> like lets say you get banned then you get to honor 5 and stay there for say a year or 2 then you basically get your "chance" back.

The years of honor gets you all the rewards that honor gets you. But honor is not a buffer for avoiding punishment. It's a system to give you free rewards for remaining civil.

Im not sayign get on league and yell at everyone for everything they do to get your anger out i just meant you play the game as an outlet. slaying creeps and such is satisfying. But im not saying run it down just cause of your bad day. Im saying play your favorite game. And in this effect league is my favorite game. 

youre talking about rewards that give me nothing cause i bought everything.

edit: Ok i type that in haste. Thats arrogant, im just meaning to say that people who get these rewards love league, like its hard to get to honor 5, and i see less and less ppl with honor 5.

And i just think that people with it deserve more then free in game merch.

> [{quoted}](name=DecayedPenguini,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=kG7kqOMn,comment-id=0001000000000001,timestamp=2020-01-30T20:35:42.021+0000)

But im not saying run it down just cause of your bad day. Im saying play your favorite game. And in this effect league is my favorite game. 

You don't get in trouble for slaying creeps. You can only get in trouble for inappropriate interactions with other players.


> youre talking about rewards that give me nothing cause i bought everything.

That doesn't stop them from being rewards. You get orange essence as well from the chests you open with the keys.

> edit: Ok i type that in haste. Thats arrogant, im just meaning to say that people who get these rewards love league, like its hard to get to honor 5, and i see less and less ppl with honor 5.
> 
> And i just think that people with it deserve more then free in game merch.

It's a free game. The fact that you get stuff that normally costs money withing having to pay is a pretty nice bonus.

> used as an outlet of anger

It's not supposed to be an **outlet for anger**. Go hit a punching bag for that.

Video games are **entertainment** and should be a stress reliever, not something that you get so worked up over that you flame your teammates and intentionally feed.

misread again. I didnt use it to flame im saying if you got flamed after your bad day. But again i didnt use it in this manner and personally i mute everyone when im having  a bad day. 

But I play League when i have a bad day because its my favorite game to play. I honestly like feeling praise. So when i do good and a team mate says "gj" "wp" any of those things i feel happier. 

Thats what i mean as an outlet. Not everyone gets their anger out physically ive done sports all my life since i was 3 years old. Im 23 now and i take my anger out on video games because my anger is built up from sports, thanks to being forced into them by my family.  (im severely injured and cant do a lot of physically things anymore.
It's up to you to make your Honor level mean something.
